meanings.definition: To eject or discharge suddenly and forcefully in a stream or jet.
meanings.sent1: The water splurted out of the hose when I turned it on.
meanings.sent2: The soda splurted out of the can when I shook it.
meanings.sent3: As I squeezed the ketchup bottle, it splurted all over my plate!
meanings.sent4: The volcano splurted lava into the sky, creating a fiery display.
meanings.sent5: The burst pipe splurted water everywhere, causing a mess.

meanings.sent1: She splurted out the answer before anyone else could speak.
meanings.sent2: He splurted out his excitement about the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent3: In her nervousness, she splurted out a string of random words.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor splurted out the breaking news to the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The child splurted out his request for ice cream with enthusiasm.
